title: How to Prepare Carne Asada Tacos

steps.headline: Heat the cooking oil, or lard in a skillet on medium-high.
Make the taco shells.
steps.description: Use a pair of tongs to hold half of the tortilla under the oil for 1 to 2 minutes until the shell becomes slightly firm and golden brown in color. Flip the tortilla over in the skillet and repeat.

steps.headline: Set the shell over a paper towel with the closed side facing up so the excess oil can drain.
steps.description: Repeat the process to prepare the remaining taco shells.

steps.headline: Pit and peel the avocado.
steps.description: Using a chef's knife, cut the avocado in half all the way around the pit, parallel to the stem cavity. Pull the 2 avocado halves apart. Hold the avocado with 1 hand on 1 side of the cut and 1 hand on the other. Twist each half of the avocado in opposite directions and gently pulling the 2 halves apart. Remove the avocado pit. Place the avocado with the pit in it on a clean cutting surface and strike the pit in the center with your chef's knife. Use the knife to twist and pull the pit out. Use a spoon to scoop the flesh of each avocado half out of its skin.

steps.headline: Place the pitted and skinned avocados, 2 tbsp.
steps.description: (30 g) of chopped onion, 1 1/2 tbsp. (22 g) of chopped cilantro, 1 tbsp. (15 g) of finely chopped serrano chiles, and 1 tsp. (5 g) of salt into a medium-sized mixing bowl.

steps.headline: Stir the ingredients just enough to be evenly mixed; do not over stir.
steps.description: Squeeze in the juice of 1 lime wedge. Cover and refrigerate the guacamole.

steps.headline: Peal and chop the tomatoes.
steps.description: Fill a medium-sized pot 2/3 full of water, place on high heat and bring to a boil.

steps.headline: Core the tomatoes and cut a small "X" on each using a pairing knife.
Drop the tomatoes in the boiling water and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Remove the pot and place it in the sink under cold, running water until the tomatoes have cooled completely.
Remove the tomatoes and, using a pairing knife, peel the tomatoes, starting from the corner on the bottom of the tomato where you made the "X" cut.
Cut the tomatoes in rough chunks about the size of a thumbnail.
Place the peeled, and chopped tomatoes, along with the remaining cilantro,  onions and chilies into a medium-sized mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add 1 tsp. (5 g) of salt, squeeze in 2 lime wedges and mix loosely. Serve at room temperature.

parts.name: Prepare the Meat for the Carne Asada Tacos

steps.headline: Cut 2 lbs.
steps.description: (910 g) of skirt steak into thin strips, approximately 2 inches (5 cm) long and a 1/2 inch (1.2 cm) wide.

steps.headline: Place the meat into a large, well greased iron skillet or flat grill on medium-high heat.
Squeeze the remainder of the lime wedges over the meat and season with 3 tsp.
Stir the meat in the skillet until it is evenly browned on all sides.
steps.description: Remove from heat and set aside.

steps.headline: Fill the bottom of each shell with the carne asada.
Fill the rest of the taco with shredded lettuce and top with cotija cheese.
Repeat this process to prepare the desired number of tacos.
steps.description: Serve with rice and beans as an entrée or without as an appetizer. Recipe serves 4 to 6 people.

text: Prepare the Taco Shells Heat the cooking oil, or lard in a skillet on medium-high.  Make the taco shells. Use a pair of tongs to hold half of the tortilla under the oil for 1 to 2 minutes until the shell becomes slightly firm and golden brown in color. Flip the tortilla over in the skillet and repeat. Set the shell over a paper towel with the closed side facing up so the excess oil can drain. Repeat the process to prepare the remaining taco shells. Make the Guacamole Pit and peel the avocado. Using a chef's knife, cut the avocado in half all the way around the pit, parallel to the stem cavity. Pull the 2 avocado halves apart. Hold the avocado with 1 hand on 1 side of the cut and 1 hand on the other. Twist each half of the avocado in opposite directions and gently pulling the 2 halves apart. Remove the avocado pit. Place the avocado with the pit in it on a clean cutting surface and strike the pit in the center with your chef's knife. Use the knife to twist and pull the pit out. Use a spoon to scoop the flesh of each avocado half out of its skin. Place the pitted and skinned avocados, 2 tbsp. (30 g) of chopped onion, 1 1/2 tbsp. (22 g) of chopped cilantro, 1 tbsp. (15 g) of finely chopped serrano chiles, and 1 tsp. (5 g) of salt into a medium-sized mixing bowl. Stir the ingredients just enough to be evenly mixed; do not over stir. Squeeze in the juice of 1 lime wedge. Cover and refrigerate the guacamole. Make the Fresh Tomato Salsa Peal and chop the tomatoes. Fill a medium-sized pot 2/3 full of water, place on high heat and bring to a boil. Core the tomatoes and cut a small "X" on each using a pairing knife.  Drop the tomatoes in the boiling water and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.  Remove the pot and place it in the sink under cold, running water until the tomatoes have cooled completely.  Remove the tomatoes and, using a pairing knife, peel the tomatoes, starting from the corner on the bottom of the tomato where you made the "X" cut.  Cut the tomatoes in rough chunks about the size of a thumbnail.  Place the peeled, and chopped tomatoes, along with the remaining cilantro,  onions and chilies into a medium-sized mixing bowl. Add 1 tsp. (5 g) of salt, squeeze in 2 lime wedges and mix loosely. Serve at room temperature. Prepare the Meat for the Carne Asada Tacos Cut 2 lbs. (910 g) of skirt steak into thin strips, approximately 2 inches (5 cm) long and a 1/2 inch (1.2 cm) wide. Place the meat into a large, well greased iron skillet or flat grill on medium-high heat.  Squeeze the remainder of the lime wedges over the meat and season with 3 tsp. (15 g) of salt. Stir the meat in the skillet until it is evenly browned on all sides. Remove from heat and set aside. Prepare the Carne Asada Tacos Fill the bottom of each shell with the carne asada.  Fill the rest of the taco with shredded lettuce and top with cotija cheese.  Repeat this process to prepare the desired number of tacos. Serve with rice and beans as an entrée or without as an appetizer. Recipe serves 4 to 6 people.
